intro: Orbignya urbaniana, commonly known as the balsa tree, is a tropical tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It is characterized by its light, porous wood, which is among the lightest in the world. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are typically elliptical in shape. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by elongated, woody fruits. The species is well adapted to wet, humid environments and plays an important role in the ecological balance of its habitat.
